Package ohos.media.image

Class PixelMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.image.PixelMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public class PixelMap
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Provides images in forms of pixel matrices.

    Applications can use methods, such as getImageInfo(), to obtain basic image information.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#IMAGE

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static PixelMap create​(int[] colors,
                              PixelMap.InitializationOptions opts)
        Creates a pixel map based on initialization options (such as the image size, pixel format, and alpha type) and the data source described by a pixel color array.
        Parameters:
        colors - Indicates an int array of pixel colors. Each element in the array is in PixelFormat#ARGB_8888 format.
        opts - Indicates initialization options of the pixel map.
        Returns:
        Returns the PixelMap instance if the creation is successful; returns null otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if any of the following occurs:
        • The image size is null.
        • The width and height are less than or equal to 0.
        • The length of the pixel color array is less than the number of image pixels.
        Since:
        3

      • create

        public static PixelMap create​(int[] colors,
                              int offset,
                              int stride,
                              PixelMap.InitializationOptions opts)
        Creates a pixel map based on initialization options (such as the image size, pixel format, and alpha type) and the data source described by a pixel color array, start offset, and number of pixels in a row.
        Parameters:
        colors - Indicates an int array of color values. Each element in the array is in PixelFormat#ARGB_8888 format.
        offset - Indicates the offset from where to read pixel color data in the array.
        stride - Indicates the number of pixel color elements in each row of the array. The value must be greater than or equal to the width of the pixel map to be created.
        opts - Indicates initialization options of the pixel map.
        Returns:
        Returns the PixelMap instance if the creation is successful; returns null otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if any of the following occurs:
        • The image size is null.
        • The width and height are less than or equal to 0.
        • The number of available elements in the array is less than the number of image pixels.
        • The value of stride is smaller than the width of the pixel map.
        Since:
        3

      • create

        public static PixelMap create​(PixelMap.InitializationOptions opts)
        Creates a pixel map based on initialization options (such as the image size, pixel format, and alpha type).
        Parameters:
        opts - Indicates initialization options of the pixel map.
        Returns:
        Returns the PixelMap instance if the creation is successful; returns null otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the image size is null, or the width and height are less than or equal to 0.
        Since:
        3

      • create

        public static PixelMap create​(PixelMap source,
                              PixelMap.InitializationOptions opts)
        Creates a pixel map based on initialization options (such as the image size, pixel format, and alpha type) and the data source described by a source pixel map.
        Parameters:
        source - Indicates the PixelMap instance as the data source.
        opts - Indicates initialization options of the pixel map. If the value is null, the target pixel map will be created from a copy of the source pixel map.
        Returns:
        Returns the new PixelMap instance if the creation is successful; returns null otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if any of the following occurs:
        • The source pixel map is null.
        • Native resources associated with the source pixel map have been released.
        • The image width or height specified in opts is less than 0.
        Since:
        3

      • create

        public static PixelMap create​(PixelMap source,
                              Rect srcRegion,
                              PixelMap.InitializationOptions opts)
        Creates a pixel map based on initialization options (such as the image size, pixel format, and alpha type) and the data source described by a source pixel map and the expected area on it.
        Parameters:
        source - Indicates the source PixelMap.
        srcRegion - Indicates the expected region on the source pixel map.
        opts - Indicates initialization options of the pixel map. If this parameter is null, the new pixel map will be a copy of the source pixel map.
        Returns:
        Returns the new PixelMap instance if the creation is successful; returns null otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if any of the following occurs:
        • The source pixel map is null.
        • Native resources associated with the source pixel map have been released.
        • The srcRegion is out of the source pixel map.
        • The image width or height specified in opts is less than 0.
        Since:
        3

        Obtains basic image information.

        Basic image information is provided by ImageInfo, including the image size, pixel format, and color space.

        Returns:
        Returns an ImageInfo object.
        Since:

      • finalize

        protected void finalize​()
                 throws Throwable
        Description copied from class: Object
        Called by the garbage collector on an object when garbage collection determines that there are no more references to the object. A subclass overrides the finalize method to dispose of system resources or to perform other cleanup.

        The general contract of finalize is that it is invoked if and when the Java™ virtual machine has determined that there is no longer any means by which this object can be accessed by any thread that has not yet died, except as a result of an action taken by the finalization of some other object or class which is ready to be finalized. The finalize method may take any action, including making this object available again to other threads; the usual purpose of finalize, however, is to perform cleanup actions before the object is irrevocably discarded. For example, the finalize method for an object that represents an input/output connection might perform explicit I/O transactions to break the connection before the object is permanently discarded.

        The finalize method of class Object performs no special action; it simply returns normally. Subclasses of Object may override this definition.

        The Java programming language does not guarantee which thread will invoke the finalize method for any given object. It is guaranteed, however, that the thread that invokes finalize will not be holding any user-visible synchronization locks when finalize is invoked. If an uncaught exception is thrown by the finalize method, the exception is ignored and finalization of that object terminates.

        After the finalize method has been invoked for an object, no further action is taken until the Java virtual machine has again determined that there is no longer any means by which this object can be accessed by any thread that has not yet died, including possible actions by other objects or classes which are ready to be finalized, at which point the object may be discarded.

        The finalize method is never invoked more than once by a Java virtual machine for any given object.

        Any exception thrown by the finalize method causes the finalization of this object to be halted, but is otherwise ignored.

        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
        Throws:
        Throwable - the Exception raised by this method
        See Also:
        WeakReference, PhantomReference

      • isSameImage

        public boolean isSameImage​(PixelMap other)
        Checks whether this PixelMap is the same as the specified one, including the attribute information described by the ImageInfo instance and pixel data.
        Parameters:
        other - Indicates the specified PixelMap to compare.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the two images are the same; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the specified PixelMap is empty.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this PixelMap have been released.
        Since:
        3

      • readPixel

        public int readPixel​(Position pos)
        Reads the color value at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        pos - Indicates the coordinate of the pixel.
        Returns:
        Returns the color value, which is of the AlphaType#UNPREMUL type and in PixelFormat#ARGB_8888 format.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the passed coordinate position is null or out of the valid range of the image.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this PixelMap have been released.
        Since:
        3

      • readPixels

        public void readPixels​(int[] pixels,
                       int offset,
                       int stride,
                       Rect region)
        Reads the color values of a specified region and writes them into a pixels array with the specified start offset and stride. The color values are of the AlphaType#UNPREMUL type and in PixelFormat#ARGB_8888 format.
        Parameters:
        pixels - Indicates the array storing the color value copies.
        offset - Indicates the offset into which the color values will be written.
        stride - Indicates the number of color values stored in each row of the array. The parameter value must be greater than or equal to the width of the specified source region.
        region - Indicates the source region to obtain the color values.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this PixelMap have been released.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if any of the following occurs:
        • The pixels array is null.
        • The offset value is less than 0 or larger than the pixels array length.
        • The stride value is less than 0.
        • The region value is null or out of the valid range of the image.
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - Throws this exception if the pixels array is too small to accommodate the color values.
        Since:
        3

      • readPixels

        public void readPixels​(Buffer dst)
        Reads a copy of color values of this PixelMap instance and stores it to the specified buffer.
        Parameters:
        dst - Indicates the buffer storing the color value copies.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this PixelMap have been released.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the buffer is null or the format is not supported.
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - Throws this exception if the size of the color values exceeds the buffer capacity.
        Since:
        3

      • resetConfig

        public void resetConfig​(Size size,
                        PixelFormat pixelFormat)
        Resets the size and pixel format of this PixelMap. This method does not change the original pixel data, or reallocate the memory for storing the pixel data.
        Parameters:
        size - Indicates the target image size after the reset, in bytes. The value must not exceed the memory occupied by this PixelMap.
        pixelFormat - Indicates pixel format to reset.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this PixelMap have been released, or the PixelMap cannot be edited.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the memory capacity required by the target image size and pixel format exceeds the available capacity.
        Since:
        3

      • setAlphaType

        public void setAlphaType​(AlphaType alphaType)
        Sets the alpha type of this PixelMap.
        Parameters:
        alphaType - Indicates the AlphaType to set.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this PixelMap have been released, or the PixelMap cannot be edited.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input AlphaType is invalid.
        Since:
        3

      • writePixel

        public void writePixel​(Position pos,
                       int color)
        Writes the color value into the specified position.
        Parameters:
        pos - Indicates the coordinate position to write the pixel value.
        color - Indicates the color value to write, which is of the AlphaType#UNPREMUL type and in PixelFormat#ARGB_8888 format.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this PixelMap have been released, or the PixelMap cannot be edited.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the coordinate position is null or out of the valid range of the image.
        Since:
        3

      • writePixels

        public void writePixels​(int[] pixels,
                        int offset,
                        int stride,
                        Rect region)
        Writes data from the specified color data array (based on the start offset and stride) into the specified region of this PixelMap. The color data to write is of the AlphaType#UNPREMUL type and in PixelFormat#ARGB_8888 format.
        Parameters:
        pixels - Indicates the array of color data.
        offset - Indicates the offset from which the color data will be read.
        stride - Indicates the number of pixels in each row of the array. The value must be greater than or equal to the width of the target region in this PixelMap.
        region - Indicates the target pixel map region into which the data will be written.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this PixelMap have been released, or the PixelMap cannot be edited.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if any of the following occurs:
        • The pixels array is null.
        • The offset value is less than 0 or larger than the pixels array length.
        • The stride value is less than 0.
        • The region value is out of the valid range of the image.
        Since:
        3

      • writePixels

        public void writePixels​(Buffer src)
        Writes the pixel data in the specified buffer into this PixelMap. The buffer data will overwrite the PixelMap data, so the color format of the source data must be compatible with this PixelMap.
        Parameters:
        src - Indicates the buffer whose pixel data will be written.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this PixelMap have been released, or the PixelMap cannot be edited.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the buffer is null or the format is not supported.
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - Throws this exception if the data in the buffer is insufficient to fill the PixelMap.
        Since:
        3

      • writePixels

        public void writePixels​(int color)
        Writes the specified color value into this PixelMap.
        Parameters:
        color - Indicates the color value to write, which is of the AlphaType#UNPREMUL type and in PixelFormat#ARGB_8888 format.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if native resources associated with this PixelMap have been released, or the PixelMap cannot be edited.
        Since:
        3
